dt: {bc}a computer file format for the compression and storage of visual digital information
{bc}an image or video stored in this format

dt.t: Using emoji, emoticons and {wi}GIFs{/wi} in a texted conversation instantly signals the difference between sincerity and a joke or sarcasm.

shortdef: a computer file format for the compression and storage of visual digital information; also : an image or video stored in this format

dt: {bc}a {d_link|GIF|GIF} of someone or something (such as a celebrity or an animal) that is sent or posted in reply to something (such as a text message or a social media post or comment) and that typically depicts and expresses a reaction

dt.t: Now, six seasons in, it's safe to say the legacy of {it}Schitt's Creek{/it} goes far beyond legions of fans using {wi}reaction GIFs{/wi} from the show on Twitter.

I'll be clear: If you search a word and use a top-10 {wi}reaction GIF{/wi}, you're not being funny. I'll be even more direct: You're not even mildly entertaining anyone with your Jennifer-Lawrence-spit-take reaction.

Or perhaps the warm fuzzy nostalgia we draw from The Simpsons is where we find refuge in an online world that's increasingly divisive, loud and stressful. If we can find empathy in a cartoon {wi}reaction gif{/wi}, maybe that proves that things are never truly that bad.

Grumpy Cat was arguably the world's most famous and popular puss, with more than 2.5 million followers on Instagram. Her permanently scowling, unimpressed face was the original digital language for displeasure, cynicism and apathy and became one of the first {wi}reaction gifs{/wi}.

{wi}Reaction GIFs{/wi} show up everywhere, both professional and socially, in text messages, emails, social media and, of course, chat-based conversations at work. They have the ability to add context and emotion to words, generally making our statements more engaging.

shortdef: a GIF of someone or something (such as a celebrity or an animal) that is sent or posted in reply to something (such as a text message or a social media post or comment) and that typically depicts and expresses a reaction
